message.content:
cs.DS, cs.GT, cs.LG, cs.RO, cs.IT. 

The paper deals with optimization problems under uncertainty, which is a topic that falls under several subfields of computer science. The use of probability distributions and scenarios suggests that the paper could belong to cs.IT (Information Theory) or cs.LG (Machine Learning), but the focus on approximation algorithms and discrete optimization problems makes cs.RO (Robotics and Control) and cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) more likely. The mention of LP-rounding algorithms and local approximation guarantees further supports the possibility of cs.DS. Finally, the use of game-theoretic concepts such as the minimax objective function and the notion of a ball around a central distribution suggests that the paper could also belong to cs.GT (Computer Science and Game Theory).
